vcf.io

Class VariantSetReaderList

  • java.lang.Object
    • vcf.io.VariantSetReaderList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class VariantSetReaderList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Reads 1 or more VCF files at the same time. By repeatedly calling next() you can walk along genome coordinates, by having all variants found in each position. Coordinates with no variants present are not reported.

    Sample code:

    try (VariantSetReaderList readerList = new VariantSetReaderList(new LinkedList<>(files))) { while (readerList.hasNext()) { final List<Variant> variants = readerList.next(); for (Variant variant : variants) { // do something with each variant } } }

    If you are not using each variant individually, maybe you want to use the merged version:

    try (VariantSetReaderList readerList = new VariantSetReaderList(new LinkedList<>(files))) { while (readerList.hasNext()) { final Variant variant = readerList.nextMerged(); // do something with the variant } } When using the merged version, a merged header is created by joining all the vcf headers, avoiding redundant lines. To merge variants, the first variant is used as base. Then, for each other, the ID is updated and the INFO and FORMAT fields are filled with the missing values. NOTE that QUAL and filter values are not updated, and INFO values as DP or AC are not recalculated. This is a work in progress. This version is useful when using only genotype information and INFO values such as frequencies or consequences.
